lessons.title: 1. Cloud Security Fundamentals
lessons.description: Learn about cloud security challenges and best practices

pages.title: Cloud Security Overview
pages.content: Cloud security involves protecting data, applications, and infrastructure in cloud environments. It requires understanding the shared responsibility model and implementing appropriate security controls.

pages.title: Shared Responsibility Model
pages.content: The shared responsibility model defines security responsibilities between cloud providers and customers. Providers secure the cloud infrastructure, while customers secure their data and applications.

pages.title: Cloud Security Challenges
pages.content: Common cloud security challenges include data breaches, misconfigurations, insecure APIs, account hijacking, and insider threats. Understanding these challenges is crucial for effective cloud security.

pages.title: Cloud Security Best Practices
pages.content: Best practices include implementing strong access controls, encrypting data, monitoring cloud environments, regular security assessments, and following the principle of least privilege.

pages.title: Quiz: Cloud Security
pages.question: Who is responsible for securing customer data in the cloud?
pages.explanation: In the shared responsibility model, both the cloud provider and customer share responsibility for security, with specific areas of responsibility defined by the service model.
